content:
The University of Edinburgh has several campuses, but I'll provide you with some general guidance on commute times from Marchmont to the main campuses:

* **Central Campus (George Square, Bristo Square, and surrounding areas)**: Marchmont is approximately 1.5-2 miles from the Central Campus. Depending on your walking pace, it would take around 30-40 minutes to walk. Alternatively, you can take the bus (numbers 11, 15, 16, or 23) which takes around 20-30 minutes. You can check the Lothian Buses website or app for the most up-to-date timetables.
* **King's Buildings Campus**: Marchmont is around 2.5-3 miles from King's Buildings Campus. The walk would take around 45-60 minutes. You can take the bus (numbers 2, 14, or 30) which takes around 30-40 minutes.
* **Holyrood Campus**: Marchmont is approximately 2 miles from Holyrood Campus. The walk would take around 35-45 minutes. You can take the bus (numbers 2, 14, or 30) which takes around 20-30 minutes.

Keep in mind that these times are approximate and may vary depending on the time of day, traffic, and your individual pace.

If you're concerned about the commute, you might want to consider the following:

* Check the University of Edinburgh's website for more information on campus locations and transport options.
* Use online journey planners like Google Maps or Traveline Scotland to get a better estimate of commute times.
* Look into accommodation options that offer a more direct route to campus, such as properties closer to the university or those with easy access to public transport.

I hope this helps you plan your commute from Marchmont to the University of Edinburgh!
